coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.description: Define the O(4) symmetric bounce solution ansatz
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.wolfram_query: O(4) symmetric field configuration in Euclidean space

coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.description: Write the Euclidean action in thin-wall approximation
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.wolfram_language:
SEuclidean[phi_, V_] := Integrate[
  1/2 * D[phi[rho], rho]^2 + V[phi[rho]],
  {rho, 0, Infinity},
  Assumptions -> rho > 0
] * 2 * Pi^2 * rho^3
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.notes: Factor of 2π² from O(4) volume integration
Tension from gradient energy across the wall

coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.description: Define energy difference ε = V_false - V_true
Minimize action with respect to bubble radius R
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.wolfram_language:
(* Action as function of radius *)
S[R_, sigma_, epsilon_] := 2 * Pi^2 * R^3 * sigma - Pi^2 * R^4 * epsilon / 2;

(* Find extremum *)
Solve[D[S[R, sigma, epsilon], R] == 0, R]
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.notes: Balance between surface tension and volume energy
Radius at which action is extremized

coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.description: Substitute R_c into action to get bounce action B
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.wolfram_language:
B = S[3*sigma/epsilon, sigma, epsilon] // Simplify

(* Result: *)
B = 27 * Pi^2 * sigma^4 / (2 * epsilon^3)

MP = 2.435*^18; (* Reduced Planck mass in GeV *)

Bgrav = B * (1 - 3 * sigma^2 / (MP^2 * Sqrt[epsilon]))
coleman_deluccia_thin_wall.notes: Gravity makes tunneling easier; dominant at Planck scale

racetrack_potential.notes: Standard form for non-perturbative corrections in string theory

racetrack_potential.description: Define Kähler potential for modulus T
racetrack_potential.wolfram_language:
K[T_] := -3 * Log[2 * Re[T]]

(* For real T: *)
K[T_] := -3 * Log[2 * T]
racetrack_potential.notes: Standard Kähler potential for large volume limit

racetrack_potential.description: Compute Kähler covariant derivative D_T W
racetrack_potential.wolfram_language:
DTW[T_, A_, B_, a_, b_] := D[W[T, A, B, a, b], T] +
                            D[K[T], T] * W[T, A, B, a, b]

(* Explicit form: *)
DTW = -a * A * Exp[-a*T] - b * B * Exp[-b*T] +
      (-3/(2*T)) * (A * Exp[-a*T] + B * Exp[-b*T])

(* Inverse Kahler metric *)
KTTinv[T_] := (2*T)^2 / 3

VF[T_, A_, B_, a_, b_] := Exp[K[T]] * (
  KTTinv[T] * Abs[DTW[T, A, B, a, b]]^2 -
  3 * Abs[W[T, A, B, a, b]]^2
)

susyCondition = -a*A*Exp[-a*T] - b*B*Exp[-b*T] +
                (-3/(2*T))*(A*Exp[-a*T] + B*Exp[-b*T]) == 0;

(* Solve numerically for PM values *)
Tmin = FindRoot[susyCondition /. {A -> APM, B -> BPM,
                a -> 2*Pi/24, b -> 2*Pi/23}, {T, 10}]

racetrack_potential.wolfram_query: second derivative of potential at minimum
limit of V as T approaches infinity
racetrack_potential.wolfram_language:
VInfinity = Limit[VF[T, APM, BPM, 2*Pi/24, 2*Pi/23], T -> Infinity]

(* Should be > V(T_min) for stability *)
racetrack_potential.notes: Check if true minimum or merely metastable

racetrack_potential.description: Estimate domain wall tension from potential barrier
racetrack_potential.wolfram_language:
(* Find potential barrier between minima *)
Vbarrier = NMaxValue[{VF[T, APM, BPM, 2*Pi/24, 2*Pi/23],
                      1 < T < 50}, T];

sigma = Sqrt[Vbarrier - VF[9.865, APM, BPM, 2*Pi/24, 2*Pi/23]] *
        Abs[Tbarrier - 9.865]

vacuum_lifetime.description: Define decay rate per unit volume
vacuum_lifetime.wolfram_language:
(* Prefactor A ~ M_P^4 in natural units *)
MP = 2.435*^18; (* GeV *)
A = MP^4;

GammaPerVolume[B_] := A * Exp[-B]
vacuum_lifetime.notes: Semiclassical decay rate from WKB approximation

vacuum_lifetime.wolfram_language:
(* Hubble constant *)
H0 = 72.55 * (3.24*^-20); (* 72.55 km/s/Mpc in Hz *)

(* Hubble radius in GeV^-1 *)
RH = (3*^8) / H0 / (1.973*^-16); (* c/H0 in GeV^-1 *)

(* Hubble volume *)
VHubble = 4 * Pi * RH^3 / 3

vacuum_lifetime.description: Calculate decay probability in Hubble volume
vacuum_lifetime.notes: Probability that at least one bubble nucleates

vacuum_lifetime.wolfram_language:
(* For P_decay < 10^-10 (cosmologically stable) *)
Bcrit = -Log[10^-10 / (VHubble * tUniverse)] / Log[Exp[1]]

Print["Critical bounce action: ", Bcrit]
vacuum_lifetime.notes: Below this, vacuum could decay within age of universe

vacuum_lifetime.description: Compute lifetime τ from bounce action
vacuum_lifetime.wolfram_language:
Lifetime[B_] := 1 / (GammaPerVolume[B] * VHubble) /
                (365.25 * 24 * 3600);

(* For B = 400 *)
tau400 = Lifetime[400]

(* For B = 1000 (absolutely stable) *)
tau1000 = Lifetime[1000]

higgs_stability.description: Write RG equation for Higgs self-coupling λ
higgs_stability.wolfram_language:
(* Simplified 1-loop beta function *)
betaLambda[lambda_, yt_, g1_, g2_, g3_] := 1/(16*Pi^2) * (
  24 * lambda^2 +
  (-6) * yt^4 +
  (9/5) * g1^4 + (9/4) * g2^4 +
  lambda * (12 * yt^2 - (9/5) * g1^2 - 9 * g2^2)
)
